content.description: Starting with left hand crimp below the obvious pocket in the middle of the face and right hand in the lower crimp is the easiest. Otherwise, there is a hard start with the two crimps to the right (possible V5 start). Foot hold is the ledge underneath the boulder. Bump into the main pocket, match there and static move to a decent jug. Spotter and crash pad are a must.
content.location: This is the boulder on the helipad on the lining of the trees and the clearing. The route is lit during mid-day hours. It is to the right of the main trail.

content.description: This area sees some traffic but only from hikers passing alongside. Otherwise, only climbers from The Lowers area will be around.
